p: Table 3 reports the effect of dietary treatment on milk fatty acid composition. The percentages of 14:0, 16:0, cis-9 14:1, and cis-9 16:1 were greater in the CTRL than in the PP milk. In contrast, the percentages of trans-9 18:1, trans-11 18:1 (VA), cis-6 18:1, cis-9 trans-11 18:2 (RA), and cis-9 cis-12 cis-15 18:3 (ALA) were greater in the PP than the CTRL group. Punicic acid was detected only in the milk of PP ewes, representing 0.19% of total milk fatty acids. Regarding the sums of fatty acids, the CTRL milk showed a greater percentage of SFA and a lower proportion of PUFA. Moreover, the CTRL milk had a lower percentage of total PUFA n-3. The dietary treatment did not affect the sum of MUFA, odd and branched chain fatty acids (OBCFA), and PUFA n-6.
